alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 6:39AM PST until January 19 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Fernwood, Dobson Pass, Fourth Of July Pass, Lookout Pass, Airway Heights, Pinehurst, Rockford, Kellogg, Coeur d`Alene, Downtown Spokane, Cheney, Wallace, Mullan, Hayden, Spokane Valley, Worley, St. Maries, Post Falls, Davenport, Osburn, and Fairfield. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads and walking surfaces. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and Friday evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as snow potentially mixing with sleet and freezing rain by late Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
